Hello

I am trying to solve multiphase equilibrium. There is CO2 in the gas=

phase and the aqueous phase contains various ions such as H+, OH-, and
CO3=
(-2a). When I run the equilibrium calculation (room temperature),
all CO2 i=
n the gas phase is transformed into CO3(-2a). 

Heats of formation of CO2 i=
s -94 and that of CO3(-2a) is -161
kcal/mol. But Cantera does not consider =
the formation of ion which
prevents CO2 being converted completely into CO3=
(-2a).

I have defined the ionic phase as 

stoichiometric_liquid(name =3D =
"l7",
      elements =3D " C O ",
      density =3D (1.0,'g/cm3'),
      sp=
ecies =3D """ CO3(-2a) """)

Does anyone know how to tackle this problem?

=
Thank you.
